feed.title: SAP Community - SAP Business One
feed.subtitle: SAP Business One Q&A in SAP Community

entry.title: Passing custom parameters to MenuItem in SAP B1 Web Client add‑on
entry.content:
Hi everyone,

I’m developing an addon for the SAP B1 Web Client and I’m running into an issue with a MenuButton: I’d like to pass custom parameters (e.g. a timestamp, values from another data source, etc.) to my onMenuItemPress handler, but I can’t figure out the correct way to do this via aggregations and bindings.

Below are the relevant snippets from my original code:

// overlay.json
{
  "controller": "satacon.demo.demoSata.controller.test",
  "events": {
    "dataLoad": { "procName": "onDataLoad" }
  },
  "overlay": {
    "before": [
      {
        "guid": "eYw7UEkk3Qynbr4DjuHNax",
        "items": [
          {
            "guid": "pfKjesz1qTQaNiHm3NL7xM",
            "ctrlType": "b1.sdk.CheckBox",
            "label": "Checkbox Selected",
            "selected": "{@@data1>/selected}"
          },
          {
            "guid": "bWiRc3dAXqnVaXWSodqH7B",
            "ctrlType": "b1.sdk.Input",
            "label": "Input Value",
            "value": "{@@data1>/value}"
          },
          {
            "guid": "CPBttPSfQTeAQnOnOTXiFg",
            "ctrlType": "b1.sdk.MenuButton",
            "text": "MM1 Suite",
            "icon": "sap-icon://customize",
            "buttonMode": "Split",
            "items": {
              "path": "@@data3>/menuItemData",
              "rowsData": "{@@demo>/values}",           // Is this wrong?
              "template": {
                "ctrlType": "b1.sdk.MenuItem",
                "key": "{@@data3>key}",
                "text": "{@@data3>text}",
                "icon": "sap-icon://edit",
                "keyz": "{@@data1>/key}",              // Is this wrong?
                "press": {
                  "procName": "onMenuItemPress",
                  "params": {
                    "key":       "{@@data1>/key}",
                    "text":      "{@@data3>text}",
                    "timestamp": "{= new Date().toISOString() }",
                    "customParam":"myCustomValue"
                  }
                }
              }
            }
          }
        ]
      }
    ]
  }
}
// Controller.js
define([ "./utility", "../model/models" ], function(utility, models) {
  class Controller {
    async onDataLoad(oEnv, oEvent) {
      // populate data1 and data3
      this.data1 = { selected: true, value: "hello", key: "CPBttPSfQTeAQnOnOTXiFg" };
      const oView = await oEnv.ActiveView();
      await oView.setCustomizedData(this.data1, "data1");

      const resp = await (await oEnv.getService()).ServiceLayer.get(
        "view.svc/flusso_nprsB1SLQuery?$filter=nprs_c_prg eq 'VE1200'&$select=nprs_c_srl,nprs_etichetta"
      );
      const rows = resp.getData().value.map(r => ({ key: r.nprs_c_srl, text: r.nprs_etichetta }));
      this.data3 = { menuItemData: rows };
      await oView.setCustomizedData(this.data3, "data3");
    }

    async onMenuItemPress(oEnv, oEvent) {
      const params = await oEvent.getParameter("params");
      // here I want to read params.key, params.text, params.timestamp, params.customParam
      await oEnv.showMessageBox("You selected:", JSON.stringify(params, null, 2));
    }
  }
  return Controller;
});

entry.title: Question about structure query
entry.content:
Hi,

I'm creating a price list query. For this, I need a list of ALL items with a column containing the customer code.

ChatGTP gives me this result. It works, but is this normal?

I'm not familiar with this structure. There's no link between the OITM and OCRD tables. I find it strange that this works.

SELECT
T0.[CardCode],
T1.[ItemCode]

FROM 
OITM T1
INNER JOIN OCRD T0 ON T0.CardCode = '[%0]'

entry.title: IMPLEMENTACIÓN SAC con SAP Business One 10 HANA
entry.content:
Estimados,

Nos encontramos evaluando los requisitos técnicos para implementar SAP Analytics Cloud (SAC) en conjunto con nuestro entorno de pruebas de SAP Business One versión HANA, el cual se encuentra en modalidad on-premise.

Sabemos que existen dos métodos posibles de conexión desde SAC hacia SAP HANA:

  1. Conexión directa (Live Connection)

  2. Conexión a través de SAP Cloud Connector

En este contexto, nos surgen algunas dudas que agradeceríamos puedan ayudarnos a aclarar:

  • ¿Ambos tipos de conexión requieren licencias específicas adicionales?

  • ¿Es necesario instalar componentes adicionales en el servidor SAP HANA o en otro equipo?

  • En el caso de utilizar SAP Cloud Connector, ¿qué tipo de servidor o especificaciones mínimas se recomiendan para su instalación? ¿Es necesario que sea un servidor robusto?

Agradeceríamos cualquier documentación, experiencia o recomendaciones que nos permitan avanzar de forma correcta con esta implementación.

Desde ya, muchas gracias por su colaboración.

Saludos cordiales,

entry.title: Excel Report and Interactive Analysis – SLD Logon Failed (SAP B1 HANA FP 2405)
entry.content:
Hi Community,

I'm currently using SAP Business One 10 for HANA, FP 2405.

I'm trying to log in to the Excel Report using the Excel Report and Interactive Analysis tool.

However, when I attempt to log in via the SLD (System Landscape Directory), I consistently receive the error message: "Logon failed with SLD address."

 

Interestingly, I can access the SLD using the same address through a web browser without any issues.

I’m also able to log in to the Analytical Portal successfully.

Has anyone else encountered this issue or found a solution?

Thank you.

Manish

entry.title: Material Requirement Planning for specific items in SAP B1
entry.content:
Hi Community,

I need a help for a certain scenario, 

During MRP can we selected specific items for which we can system to run MRP for in SAP B1.

For example : In database we have items : A, B, C, D, E

Now I want to run MRP for item A , C & E can it be possible?

If yes , then how please suggest 

Thank you

entry.title: GL Balance Discrepancy
entry.content:
Dear Team,
We’ve observed discrepancies in the General Ledger balance, which are affecting both the Bank account and Vendor balances. Our review indicates that an Outgoing Payment was posted on one date and later cancelled on a different date, causing inconsistencies in the reporting.

Kindly advise on the appropriate steps to resolve and correct this issue. Your guidance will help ensure accurate financial reporting and prevent similar mismatches in future transactions.

Looking forward to your suggestions.

entry.title: Request for Documentation on Fixed Asset Module in SAP Business one
entry.content:
Dear SAP Support Team,

I would like to request detailed documentation or user guides related to the Fixed Asset Module in SAP Business One.

We are currently exploring the module and would appreciate comprehensive information on the following areas:

  • Configuration and setup

  • Asset master data creation

  • Asset acquisition and capitalization

  • Depreciation types and calculation methods

  • Asset transfer and retirement process

  • Reporting and audit trail

  • Month-end and year-end closing procedures for Fixed Assets

Kindly share any available documents, best practices, or official links that can assist us in better understanding and implementing this module effectively.

Thank you for your support.

 

Regards

Abdul Rahim

entry.title: Why some Bin Location grey off and unable to inactive
entry.content:
Hi experts, any ideas why some bin location are grey off and not able to inactive it. 

I have checked the following:

  • The bin location has no stock
  • There is no open inventory Counting or Pick Lists
  • No default Assignment
  • Checked the Bin Location Master Data and confirmed that there are any restrictions or active assignments.
  • Reviewed warehouse setup and item master data to ensure the bin location isn’t set as default

entry.title: While Adding Approved PO Could not commit transaction: Error -1 detected during transaction''(PRQ1)
entry.content:
While Adding an Approved Purchase Order I am getting an error Could not commit transaction: Error -1 detected during transaction '' (PRQ1). But the Superuser can add the PO.

I have removed Addons, FMS and Commented Transaction Notification and Post Transaction Still Same Issue occurs.

SAP Business One version and patch 1000270

SAP Business One

entry.title: Unable to Reconcile USD Payment with USD Invoice If Customer is All Currency
entry.content:
Hello,

We are using SAP Business One with local currency set to EGP (Egyptian Pound).
We have a customer defined as "All Currencies".

Scenario:

- In February, we received an incoming payment in USD from the customer to a USD bank account, using an exchange rate of 60

- In June, we issued a USD invoice to the same customer, but at an exchange rate of 50.

- When trying to clear the invoice using the earlier payment (through Incoming Payments or manual reconciliation), we are facing the following issues

- The Cumulative Balance in FC (USD) is not equal to the Balance Due FC.

- The system only allows clearing in local currency (EGP) — it does not allow us to choose USD as the clearing currency.

- No option appears to settle in the original transaction currency (USD).

Question:

- Is there a way to force or allow clearing in foreign currency (USD) instead of local currency?

- How can we reconcile or match USD payments against USD invoices with different exchange rates?

- Is there a recommended workaround for this scenario 

Any insights would be highly appreciated.

Thanks

entry.title: Unable to Reconcile USD Payment with USD Invoice If Customer is All Currency
entry.content:
Hello,

We are using SAP Business One with local currency set to EGP (Egyptian Pound).
We have a customer defined as "All Currencies".

Scenario:

- In February, we received an incoming payment in USD from the customer to a USD bank account, using an exchange rate of 60

- In June, we issued a USD invoice to the same customer, but at an exchange rate of 50.

- When trying to clear the invoice using the earlier payment (through Incoming Payments or manual reconciliation), we are facing the following issues

- The Cumulative Balance in FC (USD) is not equal to the Balance Due FC.

- The system only allows clearing in local currency (EGP) — it does not allow us to choose USD as the clearing currency.

- No option appears to settle in the original transaction currency (USD).

Question:

- Is there a way to force or allow clearing in foreign currency (USD) instead of local currency?

- How can we reconcile or match USD payments against USD invoices with different exchange rates?

- Is there a recommended workaround for this scenario 

Any insights would be highly appreciated.

Thanks

entry.title: Endorse check by DI API or Service Layer
entry.content:
Via the service layer or the SDK it is possible to replicate the functionality of Converted = 'Y' when executing an Endorsement from the "Check Register" menu, checking the SDK I found this composition of the OCHH table that mentions said field

I tried to do it through DI API, but I verify that only the value in the check record changes in the payment received

 oPayments = ObSBO.GetBusinessObject(SAPbobsCOM.BoObjectTypes.oIncomingPayments)

 oPayments.Checks.Endorse = SAPbobsCOM.BoYesNoEnum.tYES

entry.title: GL accounts by item level
entry.content:
Hello Experts,

Currently I am using default GL account determination by item group which means any transactions that falls under particular group will use the accounts defined in the respected item group.But now I have scenarios like for some item,even it uses different revenue account unlike the revenue account defined in item group.I thought of creating new item group for those items which has different revenue account,but it may lead to defining many item groups which i dont want.I want to set GL account by item level for some item.but I dont know from where to define the gl accounts and which GL accounts must be required to fill up.Can anyone guide me please

entry.title: PO price Change-Approval process
entry.content:
Hello Experts, 

We are set price list to all vendors and mapped that price to vendors in CRM.  Now Purchase order get item price automatically form that list. I want user do not change price if he change then its go for approval. 

 

i right the query but its go for approval every time even price not change. Can you please check query & corrected it. 

SELECT DISTINCT 'True'
FROM OPOR T0
INNER JOIN POR1 T1 ON T0."DocEntry" = T1."DocEntry"
INNER JOIN OCRD T2 ON T0."CardCode" = T2."CardCode"
INNER JOIN ITM1 T3 ON T1."ItemCode" = T3."ItemCode"
AND T3."PriceList" = T2."ListNum"
WHERE T1."Price" <> T3."Price"

Regards, 

GK

entry.title: Error while updating Resource Master Data from DTW
entry.content:
Dear Expert,

We are currently experiencing an issue:
“Error while updating Resource Master Data from DTW.”

notif error : error
‘1880000009 - Future internal, committed, or consumed capacity must all be zero
for thiswarehouseResourcesService'

We have already referred to SAP Note 2690525, but the issue still persists.

Kindly request your assistance to help resolve this.

Thank you in advance.

entry.title: Balance of an item group is not matching in inventory audit report and General Ledger
entry.content:
Hi Community,
Balance of an item group is not matching in inventory audit report and General Ledger, I am seeing both the report for 01/04/2025 - 30/04/2025. Excluded the manual journal entry from general ledger but still there is difference in both the report. The Inventory Audit Report is showing more balance than the General ledger.


Please let me know how to find out the reason behind it.

entry.title: Change log - Differences screen on fixed asset master data
entry.content:
Hi All,
I was hoping you have info on how to interpret the differences window on a fixed asset master data:
This asset was fully depreciated 2 years ago(although still active).. but it shows updates by manager. However manager does not "work" on the fixed assets. So just wanted to know what these entries mean and how to interpret it. 

Thanks all,
Jerusha

entry.title: Default Output GST Tax Code by Warehouse Code in Sales Item transaction
entry.content:
Hi All

How to write a simple Formatted Search Query to select a Default Output GST Tax Code by Warehouse Code?

such as SELECT RDR1.VatGroup='ZO' where RDR1.WhsCode='Main01'

Kedalene Chong
